data.title: amazing tacos.
data.text: my partner and I had been on a road trip around California, we had been on a long drive. we found this place and were not disappointed. waiting staff were very friendly. we ordered chicken salad taco and burritos. Boy oh boy the food was fantastic. Fresh and very tasty. Cold beers. Fabulous food place. Will recommend to friends when in Huntington Beach.

data.title: Not your average taco joint
data.text: These guys are really good. They take Mexican and twist it into an upward taste.  The Cameron Coctel ( a shrimp cocktail with lots of salsa, veggies and such) is excellent.  Burritos are extravagant.  Sit in the breeze,( it's always summer in Huntington Beach) and enjoy the day.  An excellent bar as well.  This place has been around over 50 years and/or really have figured out how to get it right.

data.title: Wonderful atmosphere!
data.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants downtown. The food is amazing and the atmosphere is super relaxed!

data.title: Great Mexican food
data.text: This was some great Mexican food!! Margarita s were great and strong!! I had a healthy Chili rellano which was very good! It had no batter but was stuffed with chicken and vegetables! I would recommend this!! Good ambiance, fun place!

data.title: Different Mexican Food -  Every dish has a 'twist' on it...
data.text:
I gave this restaurant a previous rating of average.  It has been over a year and I am still rating this restaurant  3 stars.  Every menu item has been tweaked so that there is a different taste.  For example they use a lot of cilantro in the sauces and guacamole.  A guest at our table was allergic to cilantro, so asked for guacamole without the cilantro.  They needed to make guacamole fresh.  It was excellent.
I ordered the Chingolingas with chicken.  It was very dry.  But beans and rice were normal fare.  Another guest had a Chili Relleno, it was very good.  Another guest got the Chicken Fajitas with extra chicken.  Had to ask if the cook added the extra chicken at $3.00.  The answer was yes, but we still had a difficult time finding the chicken at all buried in the onions and peppers.  Also did not order tacos, as they do not offer ground beef..  I only went  again to this restaurant as we had guests from Denmark and this was where the host picked.  I went for the company.  Next time I am going for the guacamole without cilantro and chips.

data.title: California Road Trip calling in at Huntington
data.text: We ate dinner here on our Huntington stop over and we were not disappointed. The portions were huge, the food super tasty and the price very reasonable. Our server Casey was so helpful and mixed my favourite drink from back home. Would definitely recommend this place.

data.title: Dinner
data.text: Prompt friendly service even though very busy. Immediately given tortilla crisps and salsa dip.  The portion sizes were very generous - amazing value for money. The food was tasty and the meat was tender. Would definitely visit again

data.title: YUM!
data.text:
Lunch was quick and delicious! Mahi  
Mahi ceviche was generous and delightfully fresh. Skinny margaritas by the liter kept us more than satisfied. Also served to us were the street tacos and not your average taco salad. It came with grilled shrimp and grilled veggies. Lovely and helpful waitress. Also the restaurant was a pleasant distance from the touristy crowds.

data.title: Must go on Saturday or Sunday...
data.text: Avilas is the only place I know of that give you access to all you can eat menudo and chicken soup for free with your meal... Does it really get any better then that.

data.title: Smashing
data.text:
Got in without a reservation (just in time). close tables, buzzy atmosphere, great Margaritas and really fresh and tasty food (endorsed by a san bernadino native who was dining with us). Reserve if you are looking for a later table. 
Great value for money for a nice evening.

data.title: Tasty Mexican Food
data.text: Great little Mexican spot in Huntington Beach.  Family-owned for 50+ years.  Great food and even better margaritas.  Ceviche is a great appetizer and the Availa's soup is killer.  Any of the Baja bowls are really good as well.  Happy Hour is a great deal (M-F 3-6pm).

data.title: Great Atmosphere, Average Food
data.text: Visited Huntington Beach during a biz trip and happened to stop by during a festival on Main Street. Main Street was very crowded - but a fun environment. Avila's has a great atmosphere. The food was average. I would not return, though I could see it being a great place to go to with friends.

data.title: Great Fresh Food
data.text: I love going to this location.  The staff is Always friendly the food is fantastic the drinks are awesome.  Being by the beach is the additional plus!

data.title: Great food and atmosphere.
data.text: I go here often as it is a fun place within walking distance. I like the open air style. great margarita menu as well.

data.title: Yechch
data.text:
I took my child, age six, there for lunch.  The bathroom was dirty.  I asked them to clean it before my little girl used the facilities.  It took them about ten
minutes to do it, and then it was STILL dirty!  I had to take my granddaughter into the men's room instead.
The food was meh.  I will never go there again.

data.title: Pleasant and delicious
data.text: Saturday night downtown. Arrived alone and sat at the bar facing the street. Was a little neglected there, but was able to get service easily once I got someone's attention. Margaritas were great. Chips and spicy salsa were excellent. Ordered a classic combo taco and chile rellano with rice and beans. Good stuff. The crowd got louder as the night went on, but it was fun. Good Mexican food, nice staff, pleasant conversation with locals and people watching.

data.title: Great Find
data.text: My husband happened upon this restaurant when he was working and he liked it so much we went back as a family. The warm chips and home made salsa was delicious. It tasted fresh. We ordered the fajitas and a Mahi Mahi Bowl.  All of the food was cooked well and had a great taste.  The portion size was generous. The rice which can be dry in other restaurants had a great taste as well. The service was friendly and efficient! Would go back again!!

data.title: If I want to eat downtown, this is where I go.
data.text: Having lived in Huntington Beach for several years now, I don't go downtown to eat that much anymore. However, if I do, I know I can always count on El Ranchito for good service, good food, good prices and a great margarita!

data.title: Good Mexican food in a very good location!
data.text: Always good Mexican food, consistently. Like the open air dining area, so you can people watch and enjoy the scenario. Look forward to the next visit!

data.title: Good Mexican Food and Music
data.text: Great for dining and drinking at the beach. Great service, great food, nice people.  Try Sunday brunch.
